page.title: 01General Survey
page.content: The area surveyed lies in the central Cotswolds, north of Cheltenham at approximately 500' above sea level. There is only one village of any importance in the survey block, this is Shipton, a long straggling village lying parallel with the main London Road, seven miles from Cheltenham. The name Shipton literally means cattle-enclosure or sheep farm. This is of major relevance to the surveyed area which is purely rural and agricultural in character. The only buildings of any importance today are Shipton Manor, the two churches, and the Frogmill. Today, with the importance of the motor car, the village is still growing in size and the majority of the villagers work either in Cheltenham or Gloucester.
